medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Five weeks before admission, the patient began to have dyspnea on exertion and intermittent back pain. The day before admission, the dyspnea worsened.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Poland syndrome (agenesis of the right breast, pectoralis muscle, and the third and fourth costal cartilages); history of granulomatous polyangiitis (formerly Wegenerâ€™s granulomatosis) diagnosed 5 years prior, requiring intubation; pain associated with right breast implant; hypothyroidism; hypertension; supraventricular tachycardia; hyperlipidemia; herpes zoster in a thoracic dermatome (2 years earlier); remote history of cholecystectomy and tonsillectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had hypertension and died of heart failure; father died of emphysema.
medical_history.social_history: Married, no children; worked in an office; stopped smoking 25 years earlier; consumed alcohol rarely.
